item.title: China Wins as Trump Cedes Leadership of the Global Economy
item.description: “Everybody took advantage of the United States,” President Trump told an audience at the World Economic Forum on Wednesday. ]]>

item.title: He Wants New Yorkers to Have a Stake in the Knicks and the Rangers
item.description: Adem Bunkeddeko believes that Madison Square Garden Sports is undervalued, pointing out that the company’s market capitalization is roughly half of the value of the New York Knicks and New York Rangers. ]]>

item.title: Malfunction Forces Japan to Take Restarted Nuclear Plant Offline
item.description: The Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant seen from a residential neighborhood in Niigata Prefecture this month. ]]>

item.title: Help! Our Rental Car Got in an Accident, and We Can’t Get Our Security Deposit Back.
item.description:
Thrifty held on to a couple’s full deposit for over a year after an accident in Australia, refusing to provide the invoice they needed for an insurance claim.

]]>

item.title: America Turns 250: A Guide to the Coming Festivities
item.description:
Girl Scouts singing folk songs, a flag-waving party and a Times Square ball drop are among the planned Semiquincentennial celebrations.

]]>

item.title: Oscar Nominations: ‘Sinners’ Breaks Record With 16
item.description:
“One Battle After Another” was close behind with 13 nods. Acting nominees include Teyana Taylor, Elle Fanning, Sean Penn and Delroy Lindo.

]]>

item.title: The Leverage That Europe Has Over the U.S. Economy
item.description: Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission, said in a speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, that the E.U. response to U.S. aggression would be “unflinching, united and proportional.” ]]>

item.title: Trump and ‘Taco!’ Roil Davos
item.description: President Trump’s appearance at the World Economic Forum was greeted with relief and anxiety by business and political leaders. ]]>
